snippet: In Bahrain for a meeting of the Arab states this week, the secretary of state found himself disputing arguments that Tehran was “as dangerous as ever.”
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry struggles to assuage Arab leaders who say Iran is still threat even after nuclear accord; series of Iranian military provocations in region, and ambivalent remarks by Pres Obama towards America's Arab allies, feeds tense atmosphere at meeting of Gulf Cooperation Council in Bahrain.
lead_paragraph: In Bahrain for a meeting of the Arab states this week, the secretary of state found himself disputing arguments that Tehran was “as dangerous as ever.”

headline.main: John Kerry Confronts Concerns of Arab States After Iran Nuclear Deal
headline.print_headline: Kerry Confronts Concerns of Arab States After Iran Nuclear Deal
